skill.name: ghe-status
skill.description: Read-only quick overview of GitHub Elements workflow state. Shows active threads, phase distribution, and workflow health at a glance.
skill.summary: Read-only quick overview of GitHub Elements workflow state. Shows active threads, phase distribution...
skill.author: Emasoft

security_audit.summary: The ghe-status skill is a documentation-only skill containing no executable code. The static analyzer detected 22 findings, but ALL are false positives. The skill consists of SKILL.md (documentation) and skill-report.json (metadata). Patterns flagged as 'Ruby/shell backtick execution' are markdown inline code formatting. 'Weak cryptographic algorithm' findings are plain text JSON fields. 'Hidden file access' references are documentation about configuration file paths. This is a read-only reporting skill with no network, filesystem, or command execution capabilities.

content.user_title: Check GitHub Elements workflow status instantly
content.value_statement: Stop manually checking GitHub Issues to track project progress. Get instant read-only status reports showing active threads, phase distribution, and workflow health with a single command.
actual_capabilities: Shows active DEV/TEST/REVIEW threads with assignees and last activity
Displays phase distribution statistics for workflow overview
Lists available work ready for claiming
Reports workflow health metrics and checkpoint violations
Tracks recent completions and cycle times
limitations: Read-only skill - cannot modify issues or workflow state
Only works with GitHub Elements labeled issues
Limited to repository where GHE is configured

use_cases.title: Daily standup status updates
use_cases.description: Quickly see what the team is working on without opening GitHub. Get phase distribution and identify bottlenecks.

use_cases.title: Session start context check
use_cases.description: Before starting work, see active threads and available issues. Avoid conflicts and pick up ready work.

use_cases.title: Workflow health monitoring
use_cases.description: Monitor checkpoint frequency, violation counts, and cycle times to improve team productivity.

prompt_templates.title: Quick status check
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me the current GitHub Elements status

prompt_templates.title: Active threads
prompt_templates.scenario: See what team is working on
prompt_templates.prompt: What threads are currently active in our workflow?

prompt_templates.title: Available work
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me what work is available and ready to be claimed

prompt_templates.title: Workflow health
prompt_templates.prompt: Give me a health report with violations and checkpoint frequency

output_examples.input: Show me the GitHub Elements status
output: | Issue | Type | Phase | Epic | Assignee | Last Activity |
DEV: 3 active | TEST: 1 active | REVIEW: 0 active

output_examples.input: What is the team currently working on?

best_practices: Use at session start to understand current context and avoid conflicts
Check before claiming new work to see what is already in progress
Review Argos-queued work first as it represents urgent automation findings
anti_patterns: Do not use for detailed metrics - use ghe-report for comprehensive analysis
Do not use to claim issues - use ghe-claim for that functionality
Do not use for phase transitions - use ghe-transition instead

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with all GitHub repositories?
faq.answer: No, it only works with repositories configured for GitHub Elements workflow using the specific label system.

faq.question: Does it modify any GitHub Issues?
faq.answer: No, this is a read-only skill that only queries and displays information without making any changes.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my CI/CD pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill works anywhere GitHub CLI is available and authenticated, including CI environments.

faq.question: Is my GitHub data safe?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill only reads public GitHub issue data using official GitHub CLI commands and does not store or transmit data elsewhere.

faq.question: Why does it show different information than GitHub native issues view?
faq.answer: It filters and organizes issues based on GitHub Elements workflow labels and phases, providing workflow-specific insights.

faq.question: How does this compare to GitHub Projects?
faq.answer: GitHub Elements provides AI-assisted workflow management with automated phase transitions and memory persistence through issue threads.
